Macros

#define VPS_M2M_DSS_INST_WB1   (0U)
 DSS WB0 memory driver instance number.
 
#define VPS_M2M_DSS_INST_MAX   (1U)
 Maximum number of M2M DSS driver instance. Note: This is a read only macro. Don't modify the value of this macro.
 
#define VPS_M2M_DSS_IOCTL_BASE   (VPS_M2M_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0400U)
 M2M Generic Interface IOCTL base. VPS_M2M_IOCTL_BASE + 0x100U to 0x300U already used by other M2M drivers.

M2M interface max limits or defaults.

#define VPS_M2M_DSS_MAX_HANDLE_PER_INST   (1U)
 Maximum number of handles supported by M2M driver per driver instance. Note: This is a read only macro. Don't modify the value of this macro.
 
#define VPS_M2M_DSS_DEF_QUEUE_LEN   (BSP_CFG_M2M_DSS_QUEUE_LEN_HANDLE)
 Default max number of M2M operation request that can be queued per handle.
 

Detailed Description

This modules define APIs to DSS memory to memory driver in VPS.

DSS M2M Interface driver supports the following FVID2 APIs (see also FVID2 API)

  • Creating the driver - Fvid2_create()
    Parameter Value
    drvId FVID2_VPS_DSS_M2M_DRV
    instanceId Driver specific instance id
    createArgs Vps_M2mDssCreateParams *
    createStatusArgs Vps_M2mDssCreateStatus *
    cbParams

    Fvid2_CbParams *

    When Fvid2_CbParams.cbFxn is set, Fvid2_CbParams.cbFxn gets called for every request completion.

    Fvid2_Handle returned by Fvid2_create() is used in subsequent FVID2 APIs

  • Deleting the driver - Fvid2_delete()

    Parameter Value
    handle M2M driver handle
    deleteArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
    • Controlling the driver - Fvid2_control()
      See VPS DSS M2M writeback driver IOCTL's for the list of IOCTLs supported by the driver.

    M2M driver application flow is as follows

    • Init all required modules by calling respective module init functions
    • Create driver using Fvid2_create()
    • Set driver specific parameters using Fvid2_control()
    • Provide frames for processing using Fvid2_processRequest()
    • Dequeue processed frame using Fvid2_getProcessedRequest()
    • Delete M2M driver using Fvid2_delete()
    • De-Init modules by calling respective module de-init functions
